title: Hildr.Start1
body:
<<if not visited ("Monrjiall.off")>>
Valiant warrior! 
I ask you your name...
...so that I may know who it is that has been so wrongfully cheated.

[[Monrjiall.response]]

<<else>>
[[Hildr.Second]]
<<endif>>

title: Monrjiall.response
body:
<<if not visited ("Hildr.trust")>>
[[I will not tell you anything, you foul witch! I do not know you, therefore I cannot trust you!|Hildr.trust]]
<<endif>>
<<if not visited ("Hildr.confused")>>
[[Who has been cheated? And what does my name have to do with the poor fellow?|Hildr.confused]]
<<endif>>
[[The name’s Monrjiall, son of M’gsroell. Now, what’s this about somebody being cheated?|Hildr.explains]]

title: Hildr.trust
body:
I can assure you, I’m trustworthy.

[[Monrjiall.trust]]

title: Monrjiall.trust
body:
Oh, very well then.

[[Hildr.easy]]

title: Hildr.easy
body:
<<if not visited ("Hildr.confused")>>
Well, this might be easier than I thought...
<<else>>
On second thought, this might not be so hard...
<<endif>>
[[Monrjiall.response]]

title: Hildr.confused
body:
No, your name... 
I mean, that’s… 
What?

[[Monrjiall.victorious]]

title: Monrjiall.victorious
body:
Hah! You cannot match my wits!

[[Hildr.hard]]

title: Hildr.hard
body:
<<if not visited ("Hildr.trust")>>
*sigh* This is gonna be harder than I thought...
<<else>>
Well, this may not be so easy after all...
<<endif>>

[[Monrjiall.response]]

title: Hildr.explains
body:
YOU have been cheated, Monrjiall! 
By the very same Gods you pray upon. 
The very same Gods that have you doing their bidding. 
Those Gods have deserted you and denied you of your well deserved reward. 
The same reward every fallen warrior receives after dying in battle.

[[Monrjiall.curse]]

title: Monrjiall.curse
body:
Curse you, Gods! You deceiving bastards!
.....
What was that about dying?

[[Hildr.death]]

title: Hildr.death
body:
I’m afraid you have died today, Monrjiall. 
In the bloody battle that took place on this field today... 
...you perished while battling fiercely against several enemies. 
By all rights, I should be taking you to Valhalla at this very moment. 
However, I seem to be incapable of doing so. 
That can only mean someone doesn’t want you in Valhalla. 
And only the Gods have that kind of power.

[[Monrjiall.replies]]

title: Monrjiall.replies
body:
<<if not visited ("Hildr.deadViking")>>
[[It cannot be! I can’t be dead! You must be mistaken!|Hildr.deadViking]]
<<endif>>
<<if not visited ("Hildr.fiercely")>>
[[How fiercely was I battling?|Hildr.fiercely]]
<<endif>>
[[The Gods will rue the day they chose to cross the great Monrjiall!|Hildr.question]]

title: Hildr.deadViking
body:
Trust me, you’re dead. I know a dead viking when I see one.

[[Monrjiall.fine]]

title: Monrjiall.fine
body:
But I feel fine!

[[Hildr.exactly]]

title: Hildr.exactly
body:
Which is exactly what a dead viking would say if he didn’t think he was dead.

[[Monrjiall.replies]]

title: Hildr.fiercely
body:
What?

[[Monrjiall.repeat]]

title: Monrjiall.repeat
body:
When I died, you said I was battling fiercely. How fiercely?

[[Hildr.unsure]]

title: Hildr.unsure
body:
Uhmm...
Very fiercely?

[[Monrjiall.enemies]]

title: Monrjiall.enemies
body:
Unsurprising. And how many enemies did I defeat before my befalling? 
Fifty? A hundred?

[[Hildr.hundred]]

title: Hildr.hundred
body:
*sigh* I don’t know. 
Sure, one hundred enemies.

[[Monrjiall.proud]]

title: Monrjiall.proud
body:
Ha! If that’s not worthy of Valhalla, then it must be a very empty place up there!

[[Monrjiall.replies]]

title: Hildr.question
body:
What is it you intend to do?

[[Monrjiall.revenge]]

title: Monrjiall.revenge
body:
I shall climb to Asgard itself and make my axe decide their fate, as they decided mine.

[[Hildr.unwise]]

title: Hildr.unwise
body:
That may not be a wise thing to do. 
The gods are powerful and ever watchful... 
...ready to dispose of any they deem as potential threats.

[[Monrjiall.question]]

title: Monrjiall.question
body:
Then what am I to do? I cannot sit and do nothing about this.

[[Hildr.valor]]

title: Hildr.valor
body:
Nor should you. 
There’s still a way for you to enter Valhalla. 
You will have to prove your valor and worth by performing three tasks.

[[Monrjiall.easy]]

title: Monrjiall.easy
body:
In that case, I will be in Valhalla in no time. 
I have more valor and worth than anyone here. 
I’ll get right to it!

[[Hildr.but]]

title: Hildr.but
body:
But...

[[Monrjiall.off]]

title: Monrjiall.off
body: Off I go!

title: Hildr.Second
body:
<<if $mimirMet is true>>
[[Hildr.progress]]
<<else>>
You must search for a solution in this field.
Come talk to me after you've looked everywhere.
<<endif>>

title: Hildr.progress
body:
Have you figured out how to cross that stream?

[[Monrjiall.Stream]]

title: Monrjiall.Stream
body:
What stream? 
I found a head that talks. 
It’s saying strange things.

[[Hildr.Okay]]

title: Monrjiall.aesir
body:
Yes, it’s saying something about an important Aesir God that lived with Vanir or something of the sort.

[[Hildr.Hoenir]]

title: Hildr.Hoenir
body:
Hoenir? I haven’t heard from him in ages!

[[Monrjiall.Hoenir]]

title: Hildr.Okay
body:
Right. A head that talks. Okay.

[[Monrjiall.aesir]]

title: Monrjiall.Hoenir
body:
Hoenir! Ha! I have you now, head!

[[Hildr.NotSure]]

title: Hildr.NotSure
body:
I’m not so sure you do...

<<set $HoenirKnown to true>>
